bibl.title: Letter from Adrian Macia to Philip Showalter Hench, October 26, 1940

div1.p: Macia informs Hench that he is willing to donate Building No. 1, but must wait for his partner to return before giving a definite answer.

div1.head: Letter from Adrian Macia to Philip Showalter Hench, October 26, 1940
div1.opener:
ADRIAN MACIA
INGENIERO CIVIL Y ARQUITECTO
MANZANA DE GOMEZ 325
HAVANA, CUBA
October 26, 1940
CORRESPONDENTS OF
J. J. WINDLE & CO., INC., NEW YORK
AND
TOPLIS AND HARDING, INCORPORATED
----
TELEPHONES
M-8605 - A-7730
----
CABLE ADDRESSES
WINDLE - HAVANA
TOPLIS - HAVANA
Dr. P. S. Hench,
George Washington Hotel,
Washington, Pennsylvania.
My dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
I have to acknowledge and thank you for your very kind letter
of the 21st instant with reference to the wooden building now located
in a brickyard owned and operated by myself and partners.

I am enclosing you a copy of a letter I wrote to Mr. John J.
Moran in confirmation of our conversation here, from which you will
see that the matter is not entirely in my hands as I am only a partner
in the brickyard in question but that I would do my best to have my
partners agree. Unfortunately, one of them is at present absent on a
trip to the United States, upon whose return I shall be able to give
you a definite answer.

Assuring you of my best efforts in this worthy cause, I
remain
